content: Investments Funding Societies P2P Lending Asked by AnonymousAsked on 16 May 2019I am 20 this year and do not have a income. I use Funding Societies to invest, do i have to pay tax on the profits i earn?1 answerAnswerBump1
Answers (1)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Gabriel Tham, Kenichi Tag Team Member at Tag TeamLevel 8. WizardUpdated on 07 Jun 2019For P2P loans, you are earning interest income. That is taxable and need to be declared in iras. Dividends and capital gains are not however, P2P loans are not considered capital gains or dividends.https://www.iras.gov.sg/IRASHome/Individuals/Locals/Working-Out-Your-Taxes/What-is-Taxable-What-is-Not/Interest/2 comments1
